progre55 wrote:
> Hi people!
> 
> I'm pretty new to heritrix, so please help me out. I've been using heritrix 2.0.3, and I have set it up, everything works fine, however, after a couple of hours it throws the following exception:
> 
> 2009-06-14T04:20:54.076Z    -2          - http://xxxxxxx.xxx - - unknown #018 - - - 
>  java.io.IOException: ROS already open for ToeThread #18: xxxxxxx.xxx
>         at org.archive.io.RecordingOutputStream.open(RecordingOutputStream.java:187)
>         at org.archive.util.Recorder.outputWrap(Recorder.java:168)
>         at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpConnection.open(HttpConnection.java:759)
>         at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeWithRetry(HttpMethodDirector.java:387)
>         at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector.executeMethod(HttpMethodDirector.java:171)
>         at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:397)
>         at org.apache.commons.httpclient.HttpClient.executeMethod(HttpClient.java:346)
>         at org.archive.modules.fetcher.FetchHTTP.innerProcess(FetchHTTP.java:446)
>         at org.archive.modules.Processor.innerProcessResult(Processor.java:157)
>         at org.archive.modules.Processor.process(Processor.java:123)
>         at org.archive.modules.fetcher.FetchHTTP.process(FetchHTTP.java:680)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.processCrawlUri(ToeThread.java:310)
>         at org.archive.crawler.framework.ToeThread.run(ToeThread.java:157)
> 
> 
> 
> However, the crawl does not stop. It waits for a single url for about 5 minutes, not doing anything, and the same problem with the next url, etc. The above exception is does not show up in the heritrix_out.log, but only in the nonfatal-errors.log, so I have to stop the crawl manually.

As this is logged as a 'nonfatal' error, if it is the only symptom, it 
shouldn't be a cause for concern.

Is the real problem that there is no progress in the crawl on URLs you 
expect to be reachable?

If so:

  - are there many of these "ROS already open" errors? Do they always 
feature the same thread number (as #18 above), or same hostname, or do 
they vary?

  - is there any other error output in the heritrix_out.log or 
alerts.log, around the time progress stops?

  - are you sure the URLs remaining to be crawled are fetchable by other 
means? (Usually, a long wait in trying URLs is indicative of some 
failure to connect to a remote server.)

  - does the problem always recur at about the same interval after 
start, or against the same hostnames?

  - what do lines in the progress-statistics.log show around the time of 
the error/stop-in-progress?

  - does the problem recur in 1.14.3?

This isn't a known problem, and while it doesn't look to me like the 
"ROS already open" is a proper state, it might just be a symptom of some 
other issue, and might not be responsible for the lack-of-progress.

- Gordon @ IA
